str2: Happy, blessed, to be envied. A prolonged form of the poetical makar; supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To reproach, revile, upbraid. From oneidos; to defame, i.e. Rail at, chide, taunt.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To pursue, hence: I persecute. A prolonged form of a primary verb dio; to pursue; by implication, to persecute.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To deceive, lie, speak falsely. Middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to utter an untruth or attempt to deceive by falsehood.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Or heneken hen'-ek-en or heineken hi'-nek-en; of uncertain affinity; on account of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
